channel.title: Allie's Voice About Diabetes
channel.description: A diabetes podcast about work that is being done to improve life with diabetes
channel.copyright: Copyright 2013 Allison Beatty. All rights reserved.
channel.itunes:subtitle: This is a way of speaking with people whose life work is to make life easier for people with diabetes.
channel.itunes:summary: A diabetes podcast about work that is being done to improve life with diabetes
channel.itunes:author: Allie Beatty

item.title: Immune Vulnerability and Type 1 Diabetes
item.dc:creator: alliebeatty
item.description: Researchers have been able to identify what children may be at a higher risk for developing Type 1 diabetes. Given the higher risk predisposition, why is it some people develop T1D and others do not? Dr. Jessica Dunne, Senior Scientist of Prevention at JDRF, speaks with me about the work being done to better understand and correct the immune vulnerability related to T1D.<?xml:namespace prefix = "o" ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" />
item.content:encoded: Researchers have been able to identify what children may be at a higher risk for developing Type 1 diabetes. Given the higher risk predisposition, why is it some people develop T1D and others do not? Dr. Jessica Dunne, Senior Scientist of Prevention at JDRF, speaks with me about the work being done to better understand and correct the immune vulnerability related to T1D.<?xml:namespace prefix = "o" ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" />

Dr. Jessica Dunne, Senior Scientist of Prevention at JDRF, speaks with me about the work being done to better understand and correct the immune vulnerability related to T1D.
item.itunes:author: Allie Beatty

item.title: Diabetes Can Impair the Response to Exercise
item.dc:creator: alliebeatty
item.description: American Diabetes Association grant winner, Dr. Lauren Sparks, is an investigator at the Translational Research Institute for Metabolism and Diabetes. She tells me about her work to understand the mechanism of exercise in the body and how diabetes can affect the normal response to exercise.
item.content:encoded: American Diabetes Association grant winner, Dr. Lauren Sparks, is an investigator at the Translational Research Institute for Metabolism and Diabetes. She tells me about her work to understand the mechanism of exercise in the body and how diabetes can affect the normal response to exercise.

She tells me about her work to understand the mechanism of exercise in the body and how diabetes can affect the normal response to exercise.

media:content.media:title: Diabetes Can Impair the Response to Exercise

item.title: Game-Changing New Basal Insulin
item.dc:creator: alliebeatty
item.description:
The “holy grail” of basal insulin analogues would have vast duration, a gently rolling profile, and
natural beauty in delivery. Peglispro is a novel basal insulin analog that may wear the crown. It is being studied for the treatment of Type 1 and Type 2 diabetes. Dr. David Kendall,  distinguished medical fellow, Lilly Diabetes, speaks about the potential paradigm shifting basal insulin analog that may provide better glucose control and weight loss in people with diabetes.
item.content:encoded:
The “holy grail” of basal insulin analogues would have vast duration, a gently rolling profile, and

Dr. David Kendall,  distinguished medical fellow, Lilly Diabetes, speaks about the potential paradigm shifting basal insulin analog that may provide better glucose control and weight loss in people with diabetes.

item.title: Osteoclast Function in Diabetes
item.dc:creator: alliebeatty
item.description: Bones are important for support, protection, and mobility of the body. Diabetes can affect the body, including the bones. Dr. Shannon Wallet, Associate Professor at the University of Florida College of Dentistry, speaks with me about her work, funded by the American Diabetes Association, to better understand the mechanism of this impairment in people with diabetes and what can be done to replenish the weakness in diabetic bones.
item.content:encoded: Bones are important for support, protection, and mobility of the body. Diabetes can affect the body, including the bones. Dr. Shannon Wallet, Associate Professor at the University of Florida College of Dentistry, speaks with me about her work, funded by the American Diabetes Association, to better understand the mechanism of this impairment in people with diabetes and what can be done to replenish the weakness in diabetic bones.

item.title: GlucoTrack Non-invasive Glucose Device
item.dc:creator: alliebeatty
item.description: People with diabetes are victims of circumstance when it comes to blood glucose testing. To possibly rescue the bloodshed for all people with diabetes, Avner Gal, the CEO of Integrity Applications speaks with me about GlucoTrack, a noninvasive device to measure blood glucose.
item.content:encoded: People with diabetes are victims of circumstance when it comes to blood glucose testing. To possibly rescue the bloodshed for all people with diabetes, Avner Gal, the CEO of Integrity Applications speaks with me about GlucoTrack, a noninvasive device to measure blood glucose.

item.title: SENSUS Pain Management System
item.dc:creator: alliebeatty
item.description: The pain of diabetic neuropathy has yet to be effectively treated with a non-pill therapy. SENSUS Pain Management System is a non-invasive, electrical nerve stimulator designed to alleviate the chronic pain of diabetic neuropathy. We speak with the founder and CEO of NeuroMetrix, Dr. Shai Gozani, about the FDA cleared SENSUS device.<?xml:namespace prefix = "o" ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" />
item.content:encoded: The pain of diabetic neuropathy has yet to be effectively treated with a non-pill therapy. item.title: Biliary Tree Stem Cells
item.dc:creator: alliebeatty
item.description: A Type 1 diabetes cure is conditional on finding a reliable source of islet cells. Stem cells have been mentioned as a potential source but not all stem cells can become insulin-producing cells Researchers have identified that stem cells harvested from the biliary tree have the potential to become insulin-producing cells. Dr. Giancomo Lanzoni, Research Scholar at the Diabetes Research Institute, tells us about this exciting discovery.
item.content:encoded: A Type 1 diabetes cure is conditional on finding a reliable source of islet cells. Stem cells have been mentioned as a potential source but not all stem cells can become insulin-producing cells Researchers have identified that stem cells harvested from the biliary tree have the potential to become insulin-producing cells. Dr. Giancomo Lanzoni, Research Scholar at the Diabetes Research Institute, tells us about this exciting discovery.

item.title: Stimulated Insulin Secretion in T1D
item.dc:creator: alliebeatty
item.description: The common belief of people with Type 1 diabetes is that they cannot produce insulin. Based on the findings in a study out of University of Exeter Medical School, 75% of people with T1D can stimulate insulin production. We speak with Dr. Richard Oram, lead investigator in this thought-provoking study about his findings and what this could mean for our understanding of T1D.
item.content:encoded: The common belief of people with Type 1 diabetes is that they cannot produce insulin. Based on the findings in a study out of University of Exeter Medical School, 75% of people with T1D can stimulate insulin production. We speak with Dr. Richard Oram, lead investigator in this thought-provoking study about his findings and what this could mean for our understanding of T1D.

item.title: Minimed 530G with Enlite
item.dc:creator: alliebeatty
item.description: The Mimined 530G with Enlite is the first insulin pump system in the US that offers superior glucose control by integrating a continuous glucose monitor that it is designed to stop delivering insulin when the sensor glucose drops to a preset low threshold.  We speak with John Mastrototaro Vice President of Research and Development at Medtronic Diabetes, to learn more about this first generation artificial pancreas system with Threshold Suspend.
item.content:encoded: The Mimined 530G with Enlite is the first insulin pump system in the US that offers superior glucose control by integrating a continuous glucose monitor that it is designed to stop delivering insulin when the sensor glucose drops to a preset low threshold.  We speak with John Mastrototaro Vice President of Research and Development at Medtronic Diabetes, to learn more about this first generation artificial pancreas system with Threshold Suspend.

item.title: The Artificial Pancreas Project
item.dc:creator: alliebeatty
item.description: The challenges of diabetes make it nearly impossible to perfectly balance glucose and insulin. The Arterial Pancreas Project is the medical marvel that can help improve blood glucose for a well-balanced life with diabetes. We speak with Dr. Aaron Kowalski, a lead researcher in the Artificial Pancreas Project. He tells us how and why  the artificial pancreas will change lives of people living with diabetes.
item.content:encoded: The challenges of diabetes make it nearly impossible to perfectly balance glucose and insulin. The Arterial Pancreas Project is the medical marvel that can help improve blood glucose for a well-balanced life with diabetes. item.title: Texts to Reduce T2D Risk
item.dc:creator: alliebeatty
item.description: A study has shown that men at high risk for developing Type 2 diabetes were nearly 40% less likely to develop the disease when they participated in a program that delivered text messages to help them implement lifestyle changes. We speak with Dr. Ramachandran, Chairman of Dr. A. Ramachandran’s Diabetes Hospitals and President of India Diabetes Research Foundation, about how this innovative program changed lives.
item.content:encoded: A study has shown that men at high risk for developing Type 2 diabetes were nearly 40% less likely to develop the disease when they participated in a program that delivered text messages to help them implement lifestyle changes. We speak with Dr. Ramachandran, Chairman of Dr. A. Ramachandran’s Diabetes Hospitals and President of India Diabetes Research Foundation, about how this innovative program changed lives.

item.title: The Human Trial Documentary
item.dc:creator: alliebeatty
item.description: The true story of how Type 1 diabetes will be cured is being filmed today. The name of the documentary is The Human Trial. I spoke with Lisa Hepner, Partner at Vox Pop Films, Documentary Producer and person with Type 1 diabetes. She tells me about the documentary following 3 research teams to cure Type 1 diabetes.
item.content:encoded: The true story of how Type 1 diabetes will be cured is being filmed today. The name of the documentary is The Human Trial. item.title: Diabetes and Driving Study
item.dc:creator: alliebeatty
item.description: The study to Identify Risk Factors While Driving with T1D is imperative to driving safely with diabetes. Low blood glucose affects cognition, reaction time, vision, and judgment.  Dr. Daniel Cox is a professor of psychiatry at the University of Virginia Health System and is conducting research on people with T1D driving. He discusses the objective of his study, what we know about hypoglycemia while driving, and how this research is helping to reduce the risk of hypoglycemia accidents when driving.
item.content:encoded: The study to Identify Risk Factors While Driving with T1D is imperative to driving safely with diabetes. Low blood glucose affects cognition, reaction time, vision, and judgment.  Dr. Daniel Cox is a professor of psychiatry at the University of Virginia Health System and is conducting research on people with T1D driving. He discusses the objective of his study, what we know about hypoglycemia while driving, and how this research is helping to reduce the risk of hypoglycemia accidents when driving.

item.title: Living Vertical with Steve Richert
item.dc:creator: alliebeatty
item.description: Steve Richert has been living with Type 1 diabetes since he was 16 years old. Steve is also an active climber and determined to help other people with diabetes embrace the challenge by finding strength and self-reliance in themselves. For the next year, Steve is taking the power away from T1D and replacing it with Project 365. Steve tells us about life with T1D, Living Vertical, and the documentary Project 365.
item.content:encoded: Steve Richert has been living with Type 1 diabetes since he was 16 years old. item.title: Diabetes Alert Dog Alliance (DAD)
item.dc:creator: alliebeatty
item.description: A diabetes alert dog is an intuitive best friend to assist in your diabetes control. Debby Kay,  DAD Alliance Executive Director and award-winning canine trainer and breeder, speaks with us about the mission of DAD Alliance. Learn how the DAD Alliance is ensuring the quality of these life-saving dogs.
item.content:encoded: A diabetes alert dog is an intuitive best friend to assist in your diabetes control. item.title: Extend Nutrition
item.dc:creator: alliebeatty
item.description: The popular low-glycemic lineup of Extend Nutrition includes: bars, shakes, Crisps, and Drizzles. This week I am joined by Jonathan Lindberg and Stephanie Deisner, Outreach Manager and Outreach Coordinator at Extend Nutrition. They speak on the key points about satisfying options designed to help with weight loss, more effective diabetes management, controlled hunger, and healthier eating habits.
item.content:encoded: The popular low-glycemic lineup of Extend Nutrition includes: bars, shakes, Crisps, and Drizzles. item.title: Brain Function During Low Blood Sugar
item.dc:creator: alliebeatty
item.description: How does low blood sugar impair the brain? A study was done to test cognitive functions, in all people, during low blood sugar. I speak with Dr. Alex Graveling about the enlightening study to put words to this inexplicable experience.
item.content:encoded: How does low blood sugar impair the brain? A study was done to test cognitive functions, in all people, during low blood sugar. I speak with Dr. Alex Graveling about the enlightening study to put words to this inexplicable experience.

item.itunes:keywords: diabetes, type 1 diabetes, t1d, type 2 diabetes, t2d, hypoglycemia, low blood su

item.title: The TEDDY Study and T1D Sparks
item.dc:creator: alliebeatty
item.description: Researchers have been trying to identify causes of T1D for decades but their research has been unsuccessful. By identifying the genes that predispose a person to T1D, and studying what environmental triggers switch these genes on, the TEDDY Study was born. We speak with Dr. Kendra Vehik, about the revealing work being done in the TEDDY Study.
item.content:encoded: Researchers have been trying to identify causes of T1D for decades but their research has been unsuccessful. By identifying the genes that predispose a person to T1D, and studying what environmental triggers switch these genes on, the TEDDY Study was born. We speak with Dr. Kendra Vehik, about the revealing work being done in the TEDDY Study.

item.title: Fat Cells to Burn Energy
item.dc:creator: alliebeatty
item.description: Shingo Kajimura, PhD, is an award-winning diabetes researcher who’s making a name for himself based on the research he is doing on fat cells. He is working on a treatment to turn white fat into brown fat. Dr. Kajimura tells us about the exciting approach to turn fat storing cells into fat burning cells.
item.content:encoded: Shingo Kajimura, PhD, is an award-winning diabetes researcher who’s making a name for himself based on the research he is doing on fat cells. He is working on a treatment to turn white fat into brown fat. Dr. Kajimura tells us about the exciting approach to turn fat storing cells into fat burning cells.

item.itunes:keywords: fat cells, burn energy, fat loss, weight loss, brown fat
item.itunes:author: Allie Beatty

item.title: JDRF Children’s Congress 2013
item.dc:creator: alliebeatty
item.description: Emmie was diagnosed with Type 1 diabetes when she was 2 years old. She has lived half her life with T1D. Emmie’s mom, Kathlin, has had T1D for 30 years. Kathlin speaks with us about life with T1D, the importance of the 2013 JDRF Children’s Congress, and the trip she and Emmie will take to Washington D.C. to pursue the dream of a life without T1D.
item.content:encoded: Emmie was diagnosed with Type 1 diabetes when she was 2 years old. She has lived half her life with T1D. Emmie’s mom, Kathlin, has had T1D for 30 years.
